  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770205361</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Threads: Consuelo Jimnez Underwood</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Verlegt: Consuelo Jimnez Underwood</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Filète : Consuelo Jimnez Underwood</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Enfía: Consuelo Jimnez Underwood</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Filetta: Consuelo Jimnez Underwood</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Νήματα: Consuelo Jimnez Underwood</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Rosca: Consuelo Jimnez Underwood</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">SPARK takes a look at textile artist, weaver and teacher Consuelo Jimenez Underwood, who constructs histories of indigenous and non-indigenous conflict through her works on exhibit at the San Jose Museum of Art. This Educator Guide explores the history and traditions of textiles in various cultures, as well as the US/Mexican border.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Arts</string>
          </keyword>
          <coverage>
            <string language="en">North America</string>
          </coverage>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">FUNKEN nimmt einen Blick am Textilkünstler, am 
Weber und am Lehrer Consuelo Jimenez Underwood, der Geschichten aus 
eingeborener und nicht-eingeborener $überschneidung durch sie 
Arbeiten über Ausstellung am San Jose Museum der kunst konstruiert. 
Diese Erzieher-Anleitung erforscht die Geschichte und die 
Traditionen der Gewebe in den verschiedenen Kulturen, sowie der 
US/Mexican Rand.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">L'ÉTINCELLE jette un coup d'oeil à l'artiste de 
textile, au tisserand et au professeur Consuelo Jimenez Underwood, qui
construit des histoires avec du conflit indigène et non-indigène par
elle des travaux sur l'objet exposé au musée de San Jose de 
l'art. Ce guide d'éducateur explore l'histoire et les 
traditions des textiles dans diverses cultures, comme le cadre 
d'US/Mexican.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">A FAÍSCA faz exame de um olhar no artista de 
textile, no weaver e no professor Consuelo Jimenez Underwood, que 
constrói histories do conflito indígeno e non-indígeno através 
dela trabalhos na exibição no museu do San Jose da arte. Esta 
guia do educador explora o history e as tradições dos textiles em 
várias culturas, assim como a beira de US/Mexican.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">La SCINTILLA dà un'occhiata all'artista della 
tessile, al tessitore ed all'insegnante Consuelo Jimenez Underwood, 
che costruisce i dati storici con conflitto indigeno e non-indigeno 
attraverso lei impianti sull'esposizione al museo di San Jose 
dell'arte. Questa guida dell'educatore esplora la storia e le 
tradizioni delle tessile in varie colture, come pure il bordo di 
US/messicano.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ο ΣΠΙΝΘΗΡΑΣ ρίχνει μια ματιά στον υφαντικούς 
καλλιτέχνη, τον υφαντή και το δάσκαλο Consuelo Jimenez 
Underwood, ο οποίος κατασκευάζει τις ιστορίες της γηγενούς και 
μη-γηγενούς σύγκρουσης μέσω των εργασιών της για το έκθεμα στο 
SAN Jose Museum της τέχνης. Αυτός ο οδηγός 
εκπαιδευτικών ερευνά την ιστορία και τις παραδόσεις 
κλωστοϋφαντουργικών προϊόντων στους διάφορους πολιτισμούς, 
καθώς επίσης και τα μεξικάνικα σύνορα των ΗΠΑ/.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">La CHISPA hecha una ojeada el artista del textil, 
el tejedor y el profesor Consuelo Jimenez Underwood, que construye 
historias de conflicto indígena y no-indi'gena a través de ella los 
trabajos sobre objeto expuesto en el museo del San Jose del arte. 
Esta guía del educador explora la historia y las tradiciones de
textiles en varias culturas, tan bien como la frontera de US/Mexican.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Menschlichkeit</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>

          </keyword>

          </keyword>

          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
